title: No children nodes listed when changing data source for a data set in the query tab's data set editor page
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, no children nodes are listed.
EB: The expected result is that when changing the data source, the children nodes of the new data source should be listed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 
3. Change the data source to a different one. 

Actual result: After changing the data source, no children nodes (such as databases, tables, or columns) are listed in the data set editor page of the query tab. 

To workaround the issue, close the data set editor and reopen it.
